Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery convex vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is slightly grooved and lightly covered with a buff-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393234) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393234)
